oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Completed Units at the J.C. Napier Homes, c.1940s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of completed units of the J.C. Napier Homes (Project Tenn. 5-2, 5-2A). After the Nashville Housing Authority was first approved by the City Council in 1938, they began work on an application to build two low-cost housing projects, namely Boscobel Heights (later named after James A. Cayce) and the J.C. Napier Homes (named for James Carroll Napier). Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority, c.1940s. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
